newsitem.title: CHINA: BADMINTON-CHINA IN 28-STRONG RAID ON WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS.
newsitem.headline: BADMINTON-CHINA IN 28-STRONG RAID ON WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS.

text.p: China, fresh from a dazzling display at the All England badminton championships in March when they won four of the five titles, are confident of retaining their Sudirman Cup world mixed team title in Glasgow next month.
They are also eyeing at least two titles in the individual championships following the team event.
China are sending 28 players to Glasgow, including All England winner Dong Jiong and the man he beat in the final Sun Jun, the Xinhua news agency said on Wednesday.
Women's world number one Ye Zhaoying, a member of the winning team in the Sudirman Cup and singles title winner two years ago, has regained her form after a disappointing 1996.
The 23-year-old Ye breezed past compatriot Gong Zhichao, now ranked second in the world, to take the All England title.

World top duo Ge Fei and Gu Jun, who won the gold medal in the Atlanta Olympics, are favourites for the women's doubles and China could also take the mixed with Liu Yong and Ge Fei who are unbeaten in 1997.
The championships, starting with the Sudirman Cup, are from May 19-June 1.
